intro: Hebecoccus ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty hebecoccus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
